alert.note: Alert for Barry; Christian; Douglas; Greene; Stone; Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Webster, western Douglas, Christian, northern Stone, northeastern Barry and eastern Greene Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 859 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Strafford to near Rogersville to near Ozark to near Galena. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Nixa, Ozark, Republic, Battlefield, Rogersville, Strafford, Clever, Seymour, Sparta, Crane, Highlandville, Fremont Hills, Fordland, Duncan, Brookline, Diggins, Hurley, Spokane and Oldfield. This includes Interstate 44 near mile marker 69, and between mile markers 75 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Barry; Christian; Douglas; Greene; Stone; Webster
